result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheila Tyler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sheila Tyler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sheila Tyler was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  
May not have contact with Peter Adams until agent believes it's appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheila Tyler

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Patrick Anderson appeared for the State. Defendant, Sheila  Tyler, appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.   Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Deft. pleads Guilty to Count 2; found guilty by the court.  Counts 1 & 3 are Dismissed.  Parties waive PSI and request to proceed to sentencing.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 2 years with condition.  No contact with Peter A.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Patrick Anderson appeared for the State. Defendant, Sheila Tyler, appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Clerk: PT
Atty Michel states there was no response from previous ADA and they currently have no offer from the State.  Atty Michel to meet with ADA Anderson for a DAPT tomorrow.  FPT on 8/28/14 at 11:30 AM.

Defendant, Sheila  Tyler, appeared with Attorney William P Michel.  Attorney Jason R Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  14CF165, 14CF194:  Victim rights compliance.  Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant, Sheila  Tyler, appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  14CF165 & 14CF194:  Victim rights compliance.  Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, poss. resolution, needs more time.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 09:30 am.
ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. William Michel. Clerk LE. Case trails 14CF194. Judicial pretrial on 3-28-14 @ 9:30am. Bond continued.
